intro: Mallotus yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan mallotus, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to temperate climates. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
